required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Cervical Immobilization on Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Cervical Neck Collar and Head Blocks Strapped on the Backboard on Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter

brief_summary.textblock: Effect of Cervical Immobilization on Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter

detailed_description.textblock: Two cervical immobilization devices will be used in this study named cervical neck collar and head blocks strapped on the backboard and optic nerve diameter will be measured using point of care ultrasound and compare the effect of each type of cervical immobilisation on optic nerve sheath diameter.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of cervical neck collar and head blocks strapped on the backboard on Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter
primary_outcome.description: effect of cervical neck collar and head blocks strapped on the backboard on optic nerve sheath diameter, measured by point of care ultrasound

arm_group.arm_group_label: head blocks strapped on the backboard

intervention.arm_group_label: head blocks strapped on the backboard
intervention.other_name: head blocks strapped on the backboard

study_pop.textblock: This prospective study will be done on 100 medical students, emergency medicine and traumatology residents and assistant lecturers ,Tanta university faculty of medicine, healthy volunteers during a period of 6 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult healthy volunteers aged more than 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hx of stroke
- Inability to consent,
- Inability to lay flat on a bed or table for 15 min in duration,
- History of glaucoma, globe injury, lens implant,
- Recent refractive surgery (within the past 60 days).
- Uncontrolled hypertension

responsible_party.investigator_title: consultant of emergency medicine and traumatology
